trans-unit.source: Writes memory in a specified process

seg-source.mrk: Writes memory in a specified process

target.mrk: Writes memory in a specified process

trans-unit.source: Identifies an open handle to a process whose memory is to be written to

seg-source.mrk: Identifies an open handle to a process whose memory is to be written to

target.mrk: Identifies an open handle to a process whose memory is to be written to

trans-unit.source: Points to the base address in the specified process to be written to

seg-source.mrk: Points to the base address in the specified process to be written to

target.mrk: Points to the base address in the specified process to be written to

trans-unit.source: Points to the buffer that supplies data to be written into the address space

seg-source.mrk: Points to the buffer that supplies data to be written into the address space

target.mrk: Points to the buffer that supplies data to be written into the address space

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of bytes to write into the specified process

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the number of bytes to write into the specified process

target.mrk: Specifies the number of bytes to write into the specified process

trans-unit.source: The actual number of bytes transferred into the specified process

seg-source.mrk: The actual number of bytes transferred into the specified process

target.mrk: The actual number of bytes transferred into the specified process

trans-unit.source: [optional] Contains the data type that $pBuffer represents

seg-source.mrk: Contains the data type that $pBuffer represents

target.mrk: Contains the data type that $pBuffer represents

trans-unit.source: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

seg-source.mrk: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

target.mrk: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information
